message.content: This question tests knowledge of the effects of heat on different substances. When heat is present, a snocone at the cafeteria will melt because heat causes substances to increase in temperature and change phase from solid to liquid. Option (B) is incorrect because an ice cream cone will also melt in the presence of heat. Option (C) is incorrect because while heat can soften and melt gum, it does not cause it to completely change phase like a snocone. Option (D) is incorrect because a large metamorphic rock is not affected by typical levels of heat.

This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of heat on different substances. In the presence of heat, substances that have a low melting point, such as a snocone, will melt. Option (B) is incorrect because an ice cream cone is a container for ice cream and not affected by heat in the same way. Option (C) is also incorrect because a piece of gum does not melt in the presence of heat, it may become soft or sticky. Option (D) is incorrect because a large metamorphic rock does not melt in the presence of heat, it undergoes changes in its mineral composition and texture.

This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of heat on different substances. In the presence of heat, substances that are temperature-sensitive will undergo changes. Option (A) states that a snocone will melt, which is accurate because heat will cause the ice in the snocone to melt. Option (B) is incorrect because an ice cream cone is already a frozen dessert and will not be affected by heat in the same way as a snocone. Option (C) is also untrue because a piece of gum will not melt but may become softer or sticky. Option (D) is unrelated to the effects of heat and is a natural geological process.

This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of heat on different substances. When heat is present, it causes substances to melt or change state. Option (A) is correct because a snocone is made of ice, which will melt when exposed to heat. Option (B) is incorrect because ice cream is already in a melted state. Option (C) is incorrect because heat does not directly affect the state of gum. Option (D) is incorrect because a metamorphic rock is not affected by heat in the same way as substances that can change state.

This question tests knowledge about the effects of heat on different substances. In the presence of heat, a snocone at the cafeteria would melt because heat causes the ice in the snocone to change from a solid to a liquid state. Option (B) is incorrect because an ice cream cone would also melt in the presence of heat, so it does not specifically come about due to heat. Option (C) is incorrect because a piece of gum does not typically melt in the presence of heat, it may become softer or sticky but does not change state. Option (D) is incorrect because a large metamorphic rock is not affected by heat in the same way that ice or snocone is.

This question requires basic knowledge about the physical properties of different substances and how they are affected by heat. The correct answer is (A) a melted snocone at the cafeteria. When heat is present, substances like snocones or ice cream cones, which have a low melting point, will melt and change from a solid to a liquid. Option (B) is incorrect because an ice cream cone can melt, but it can also just become softer or lose its shape without fully melting. Option (C) is incorrect because a piece of gum will not necessarily melt when heat is present, but it may become softer and more pliable. Option (D) is incorrect because a large metamorphic rock will not melt from the presence of heat; it requires extremely high temperatures and pressure to undergo metamorphism.

Option (C) is incorrect because a piece of gum does not undergo a significant change in the presence of heat. Option (D) is incorrect because a large metamorphic rock is not affected by heat in the same way and does not melt.
